Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics

Class Shape

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.core.SFMLNativeObject
org.jsfml.graphics.SFMLNativeTransformable
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics.SFMLNativeTransformable
org.jsfml.graphics.Shape
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics.Shape
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoundsObject, Drawable, SceneObject, Transformable, org.jsfml.graphics.Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
org.jsfml.graphics.CircleShape, org.jsfml.graphics.ConvexShape, org.jsfml.graphics.RectangleShape
public abstract class Shape extends org.jsfml.graphics.Shape implements Drawable, SceneObject
Abstract base class for (optionally) textured shapes with (optional) outlines.

    • isCentered

      public boolean isCentered()
      Returns true if this shape is set to be centered.
      Specified by:
      isCentered in interface SceneObject
      Returns:
      true if this shape is set to be centered, false otherwise.

    • setCentered

      public void setCentered(boolean centered)
      Sets whether this shape has to be centered by keeping its origin at the center of its local bounds. If the origin is changed manually after this shape is set to be centered, it will be set back to the center of the sprite whenever its size changes.
      Specified by:
      setCentered in interface SceneObject
      Parameters:
      centered - true to keep this shape centered, false to reset the origin to the point (0,0)

    • removeTexture

      public void removeTexture()
      Removes the animated or non-animated texture from this shape without affecting the texture rectangle.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • setTexture

      public final void setTexture(@NotNull @NotNull ConstTexture texture)
      Sets the texture of the shape without affecting the texture rectangle, unless the texture is set to be tileable. If this shape already has this texture, this method does nothing.
      Specified by:
      setTexture in interface SceneObject
      Parameters:
      texture - the texture of the shape, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used

    • setTexture

      public void setTexture(@NotNull @NotNull ConstAnimatedTexture texture)
      Sets the animated texture of the shape without affecting the texture rectangle.
      Specified by:
      setTexture in interface SceneObject
      Parameters:
      texture - the animated texture of the shape, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used

    • setTexture

      public void setTexture(@NotNull @NotNull ConstTexture texture, boolean resetRect)
      Sets the texture of the shape. If this shape already has this texture, this method does nothing.
      Specified by:
      setTexture in interface SceneObject
      Parameters:
      texture - the texture of the shape, or null to indicate that no texture is to be used
      resetRect - true to reset the texture rect, false otherwise (this setting is ignored if texture is tileable)

    • setTexture

      public void setTexture(@NotNull @NotNull ConstAnimatedTexture texture, boolean resetRect)
      Sets the animated texture of the shape without affecting the texture rectangle, unless the texture is set to be tileable. If this shape already has this texture, this method does nothing.
      Specified by:
      setTexture in interface SceneObject
      Parameters:
      texture - the animated texture of the shape
      resetRect - true to reset the texture rect, false otherwise

    • updateAnimatedTexture

      public void updateAnimatedTexture()
      Description copied from interface: SceneObject
      Updates this texture for this object. This method is run by the scene loop and does not need to be invoked manually.
      Specified by:
      updateAnimatedTexture in interface SceneObject

    • freezeAnimatedTexture

      public void freezeAnimatedTexture()
      Freezes the animated texture at the current frame. To resume the animation, use resumeAnimatedTexture().
      Specified by:
      freezeAnimatedTexture in interface SceneObject
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this sprite does not have an animated texture

    • resumeAnimatedTexture

      public void resumeAnimatedTexture()
      Resumes the previously stopped animated texture. The animation will continue from the frame where the animation has stopped.
      Specified by:
      resumeAnimatedTexture in interface SceneObject
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this sprite does not have an animated texture

    • getTextureRect

      @NotNull public @NotNull IntRect getTextureRect()
      Gets the shape's current texture portion.
      Specified by:
      getTextureRect in interface SceneObject
      Returns:
      the shape's current texture portion

    • setTextureRect

      public void setTextureRect(@NotNull @NotNull IntRect rect)
      Sets the portion of the texture that will be used for drawing. An empty rectangle can be passed to indicate that the whole texture shall be used. The width and / or height of the rectangle may be negative to indicate that the respective axis should be flipped. For example, a width of -32 will result in a shape that is 32 pixels wide and flipped horizontally.
      Specified by:
      setTextureRect in interface SceneObject
      Parameters:
      rect - the texture portion

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(@NotNull @NotNull Shape other, @NotNull @NotNull CollisionAlgorithm algorithm)
      Tests whether this shape intersects another shape, using the specified built-in algorithm.
      • CollisionAlgorithm.AABB - axis-aligned bounding box method
      • CollisionAlgorithm.EDGES - intersecting edges method
      Parameters:
      other - a shape
      algorithm - one of the algorithms described above
      Returns:
      true if the specified algorithm detected a collision, false otherwise

    • setOrigin

      public void setOrigin(@NotNull @NotNull Vector2f origin)
      Sets the rotation, scaling and drawing origin of this shape. If this method is called when this shape is set to be centered, it will be set back to the center of the shape whenever its size changes.
      Specified by:
      setOrigin in interface Transformable
      Overrides:

    • getLayer

      public int getLayer()
      Description copied from interface: Drawable
      Returns the layer index of this object. This setting is used by RenderLayer to draw objects in a specific order. If the render layer's layer-ordering policy is set, objects of higher values will be drawn over objects of lower values.
      Specified by:
      getLayer in interface Drawable
      Returns:
      the current layer index of this object
      See Also:
      • RenderLayer.OrderingPolicy

    • setLayer

      public void setLayer(int layer)
      Description copied from interface: Drawable
      Sets the layer index of this object. This setting is used by RenderLayer to draw objects in a specific order. If the render layer's layer-ordering policy is set, objects of higher values will be drawn over objects of lower values.
      Specified by:
      setLayer in interface Drawable
      Parameters:
      layer - the new layer index of this object
      See Also:
      • RenderLayer.OrderingPolicy
